study_identification.author_journal_year: Elad et al., Human Brain Mapping, 2021
study_identification.title: Improving the predictive potential of diffusion MRI in schizophrenia using normative models -Towards subject-level classification

clarity_of_research_objectives.reason: Abstract clearly states the aim to assess whether features derived from normative modeling improve subject-level prediction versus raw dMRI values, and specifies population and outcomes (AUC).
clarity_of_research_objectives.supporting_text: we leveraged a large harmonized diffusion MRI dataset ... to study whether normative modeling can improve subject-level predictions from a binary classifier ... the best predictor achieved AUC = 0.726

clear_definition_of_target_population.reason: Population (schizophrenia-spectrum disorder and healthy controls), sample sizes, age and sex are reported, but diagnostic criteria details are deferred to a prior harmonized study.
clear_definition_of_target_population.supporting_text: includes 601 individuals diagnosed with schizophrenia-spectrum disorder ... and 512 healthy controls ... dMRI data were collated from 13 different sites

clarity_of_inclusion_and_exclusion_crite.reason: Paper refers readers to Cetin-Karayumak et al. (2020) for detailed inclusion/exclusion and acquisition protocols; not fully described here.
clarity_of_inclusion_and_exclusion_crite.supporting_text: A complete account of demographics, inclusion and exclusion criteria, acquisition protocols across the 13 sites, preprocessing and harmonization procedures can be found in Cetin-Karayumak et al. (2020).

validity_of_normative_modeling_outcome_m.reason: Normative outcomes are age- and sex-adjusted ROI-wise z-scores computed from a kernel-estimated normative distribution in healthy controls, with clear definitions and thresholding.
validity_of_normative_modeling_outcome_m.supporting_text: represented the normative range ... by an age specific weighted mean ... for each sex separately ... using the Nadaraya–Watson estimator ... deviation ... was captured by a z-score ... ROIs with z-scores above 2.999 were defined as supra-normal ... below -2.999 infra-normal

handling_of_confounding_variables.reason: Age and sex are explicitly modeled; multi-site effects handled via retrospective harmonization across 13 sites; authors note preservation of true group-related differences post-harmonization.
handling_of_confounding_variables.supporting_text: standardized preprocessing ... harmonized across sites to remove site-related differences ... evaluated the performance of the harmonization ... differences ... were removed after harmonization ... represented the normative range ... for each sex separately

clarity_of_data_sources.reason: Data drawn from 13 sites across multiple studies with prior publication cited; specific dataset names and acquisition times/locations are not enumerated here.
clarity_of_data_sources.supporting_text: dMRI data were collated from 13 different sites across a number of separate studies ... complete account ... can be found in Cetin-Karayumak et al. (2020)

description_of_image_acquisition_protoco.reason: Provides harmonized voxel size and b-value; full sequence parameters and scanner vendors are not detailed in this article (deferred to prior work).
description_of_image_acquisition_protoco.supporting_text: Following harmonization, all data had isotropic resolution of 1.5 mm × 1.5 mm × 1.5 mm, with a b-value of 1,000 s/mm2.

details_of_data_preprocessing.reason: Paper notes standardized preprocessing and harmonization per prior work; within this paper, white-matter processing steps (DTIFIT, free-water model fitting, ANTs registration, IIT atlas) are described.
details_of_data_preprocessing.supporting_text: standardized preprocessing protocol and were harmonized across sites ... The harmonized data were fitted using FSL's DTIFIT ... fitted to the two-compartment Free-water imaging model ... registered to the FA IIT template using ANTs ... IIT Human Brain probabilistic white matter fiber tract ROIs atlas v.4.1

clarity_of_data_partitioning_methods.reason: Classification performance is reported as AUC averaged over cross-validations, but specific partitioning ratios and K-fold details are not explicitly described.
clarity_of_data_partitioning_methods.supporting_text: Area under the receiver–operator curves (AUC), averaged over the cross-validations ... logistic regression coefficients, across the cross-validations

details_of_normative_modeling_approach.reason: Normative modeling uses Nadaraya–Watson kernel regression (Gaussian kernel) to estimate age-specific mean and variance in controls, stratified by sex, then computes ROI-wise z-scores; bandwidth selection via leave-one-out CV is described.
details_of_normative_modeling_approach.supporting_text: represented the normative range ... by an age specific weighted mean ... and standard deviation ... using the Nadaraya–Watson (NW) estimator with a Gaussian kernel ... we minimized the cross-validation function ... leave-one-out-estimator ... The deviation ... was captured by a z-score

details_of_training_algorithm.reason: Binary classification uses logistic regression on z-score features with cross-validation; optimization details and hyperparameter tuning procedures are not specified.
details_of_training_algorithm.supporting_text: Box plot of the logistic regression coefficients, across the cross-validations, obtained when the FAt and FW z-scores in all ROIs are inserted simultaneously as an input.

model_performance_evaluation_metrics.reason: AUC is used for classifier performance; group-level comparisons report Welch's t-tests, Cohen's d, and Wilcoxon tests; thresholding for abnormality defined via Bonferroni correction.
model_performance_evaluation_metrics.supporting_text: best predictor achieved AUC = 0.726 ... performed using 1-tailed Welch's t tests ... We also report Cohen's d ... used 1-tailed two-sample Wilcoxon rank sum tests ... threshold of |z| > 2.999

implementation_of_internal_validation.reason: Internal validation via cross-validation is used; AUC is averaged across cross-validations and coefficients summarized across folds.
implementation_of_internal_validation.supporting_text: AUC ... averaged over the cross-validations ... logistic regression coefficients, across the cross-validations

external_data_validation.reason: No evaluation on an independent external dataset beyond cross-validation on the same harmonized multi-site sample is described.
external_data_validation.supporting_text: No explicit external dataset validation is reported; performance is reported as AUC averaged over cross-validations within the dataset.

description_of_dataset_characteristics.reason: Sample sizes, age, and sex distributions for schizophrenia and controls are provided; detailed clinical characteristics and per-site breakdowns are deferred to prior work.
description_of_dataset_characteristics.supporting_text: includes 601 individuals diagnosed with schizophrenia-spectrum disorder ... 512 healthy controls ... mean [SD] age ... % male ... complete account ... can be found in Cetin-Karayumak et al. (2020)

performance_metrics_and_statistical_unce.reason: Reports AUC values and multiple hypothesis testing results (p-values, Cohen's d, Cliff's delta). Confidence intervals for AUC are not reported.
performance_metrics_and_statistical_unce.supporting_text: best predictor achieved AUC = 0.726 ... We also report Cohen's d ... used ... Wilcoxon rank sum tests ... Cliff's delta effect size

consideration_for_reproducibility.reason: Software tools (FSL DTIFIT, ANTs, IIT atlas) are named; data availability states research data are not shared; code availability is not mentioned.
consideration_for_reproducibility.supporting_text: The harmonized data were fitted using FSL's DTIFIT ... registered ... using ANTs ... IIT atlas ... Research data are not shared.

interpretation_specific_to_normative_mod.reason: Discusses that extreme deviations are not optimal predictors and emphasizes distributed, subtle abnormalities; clinical thresholds and decision criteria are not established.
interpretation_specific_to_normative_mod.supporting_text: extreme deviations from the normative model are not found in a sufficient number of individuals ... the complete distribution of deviations ... improves prediction ... suggests ... subtle and diverse

additional_comments.additional_comments: Normative modeling implemented via sex-specific, age-adjusted kernel regression (Nadaraya–Watson) at ROI level using a large multi-site harmonized dMRI cohort; classification used logistic regression on z-score distributions with cross-validation.
